args:
In the city where Dragonyule originated, Ilia and
Mordecai encounter a woman searching for her
boy. Elsewhere, Nevin and Ramiel arrive to find
a runaway. Will mother and son be reunited?
So this is what a Dragonyule celebration\nlooks like, hmm? It's quite the bustling\nlittle place.
Yeah, you can tell they've had more\npractice doing this than anywhere else.
Say, Dragonyule is your birthday, right?\nHappy birthday!
Nah, that's a bunch of hooey. Folks long\nafter my time were the ones who decided\nto spread that story around.
Uh...I guess? Sorry, bud. Didn't mean to\ndisappoint you there.
Not at all. So then, what brings you here?\nThe festivities, perhaps?
Nope! I heard the holder of a\nkey to perdition lives nearby.
You've heard of the Scrolls of Perdition,\nyeah? Big deal, everybody wants 'em,\nblah blah blahdy blah?
They are writings said to have been left\nbehind by the Goddess Ilia—by which I\nmean Meene.

That's them! They're a record of what
REALLY went down in history. Ages ago,
somebody split 'em into multiple volumes
and sealed them in the otherworld.
And if you want to get into that part of the\notherworld, you need a key made of a very\nspecific sort of mana: a key to perdition.
What sort of mana does it require?
A sacred form held by certain families\nchosen by the Goddess.
Apparently the mana is passed down\nthrough their bloodlines, parent to child.
And what do you wish to do once you find\nthe owner of this special mana?
Because we've got wars being fought over\nthat legacy, and there's no way she ever\nwould have wanted that.
I don't know why she decided to leave\nthem to the world, but as her daughter—
Oh, I'm so sorry! I wasn't watching where\nI was going! Are you hurt, miss?
Fine, thanks. Er, but you were looking\naround pretty frantically there. Did you\nlose something?
I did. The poor thing left home yesterday\nand just...never came back.
That's terrible! We should help her, Ilia.
Ha! No, sorry. The name's actually Alia.\nMy buddy here tends to mumble.
Ah, that makes more sense. A parent\nwould have to be bold indeed to name\ntheir child after the Goddess.
Ha ha! Exactly. But back to your son—\nit's not good he's been gone so long.
He's never done anything like this before.\nOh, I pray nothing has happened!
Did you try the Church? They might be\nable to lend a hand.
No, that isn't... Anyway, I'll just keep\nlooking for him. My apologies again.
Hang on! We're happy to help, seriously.\nI mean, three sets of eyes are better than\none, right?
Of course not! Now let's go find this\nmissing scamp together.
Boy this place is packed to the gills.\nYou think the keyholder's out here\nwhooping it up too?
Impossible to say. We've learned only that\nthe owner of a key to perdition MIGHT\nreside in this area.

Well if they're not in town, that means
they're out in the mountains somewhere—
and I'd just as soon not go hiking in the
snow, thanks.
What's wrong, kid? You look ready to\nburst into tears any second.
Are you hungry, child? Are you alone?\nWhere is your guardian?
Back alleys can be dangerous places.\nYou just passing through or what?
Unless I miss my guess, I think we've\ngot a runaway on our hands.
Well, we can't very well leave him\nlike this.
Take him to the Church, then? They'll give\nhim three hots and a cot, if nothing else.
Well, well. Somebody found his voice.
Is there some reason you can't go\nto the Church?
Welp, we tried. Time to pretend we didn't\nsee anything and just skedaddle—
Yeah, I know, I know. ...C'mon, kid.\nLemme buy you something to eat.
This is no place for a boy your age to be\nalone. Let us see you fed and warm.
But hurry it up, yeah? Ol' Papa Bear's\ngot places to be.
Will the paths of the Goddess's children\nand Her apostles cross?
And should they chance to meet, what will occur?\nOnly the Goddess knows for certain...
